snippet: Frequent protests have left more than 30 people dead so far, activists say, and the turmoil made a timetable for parliamentary voting on Friday untenable.
abstract: Electoral commission in Burundi, responding to appeal from African leaders, postpone planned local and parliamentary elections; Pres Pierre Nkurunziza's announcement he will seek third term has set off prolonged turmoil, with protests that have left more than 30 people dead.
lead_paragraph: Frequent protests have left more than 30 people dead so far, activists say, and the turmoil made a timetable for parliamentary voting on Friday untenable.

headline.print_headline: Africa; Burundi: Elections Delayed Amid Crisis
